de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter
Class DefaultPrettyStringBuilder

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter.DefaultPrettyStringBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
PrettyStringBuilder
final class DefaultPrettyStringBuilder
extends Object
implements PrettyStringBuilder

Default implementation of the PrettyStringBuilder interface, which is the heart of the pretty printer.

Version:
$Rev: 579 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
PrettyStringBuilder, PrettyStringBuilderFactory

Constructor Summary
DefaultPrettyStringBuilder(PrettyPrintable printable, int returnPriority)
          Allocates a new DefaultPrettyStringBuilder for the printable, where the priority used for the printable is returnPriority.

Constructor Detail

DefaultPrettyStringBuilder

DefaultPrettyStringBuilder(PrettyPrintable printable,
                           int returnPriority)
Allocates a new DefaultPrettyStringBuilder for the printable, where the priority used for the printable is returnPriority.

Parameters:
printable - the printable for which to generate a pretty string.
returnPriority - the priority for the printable, which determines where and when to add parenthesis around PrettyPrintables added to this builder.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if printable is null.
Method Detail

addBreak

public void addBreak()
Appends a break location to the string builder. A break marks the location as possible newline insertion position for the presenter.

Specified by:
addBreak in interface PrettyStringBuilder
See Also:
PrettyStringBuilder.addBreak()

addBuilder

public void addBuilder(PrettyStringBuilder builder,
                       int argumentPriority)
Inserts the given builder at the specified argumentPriority at the end of our builder. If the return priority of the builder is less than the specified argumentPriority, parenthesis will be added around the text generated for the builder.

Specified by:
addBuilder in interface PrettyStringBuilder
Parameters:
builder - the PrettyStringBuilder to insert.
argumentPriority - the argument priority of the builder.
See Also:
PrettyStringBuilder.addBuilder(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter.PrettyStringBuilder, int)

addConstant

public void addConstant(String constant)
Appends the given constant to the pretty string builder. Constants will be highlighted when displayed to the user.

Specified by:
addConstant in interface PrettyStringBuilder
Parameters:
constant - the constant to append.
See Also:
PrettyStringBuilder.addConstant(java.lang.String)

addKeyword

public void addKeyword(String keyword)
Appends the given keyword to the pretty string builder. Keywords will be highlighted when displayed to the user.

Specified by:
addKeyword in interface PrettyStringBuilder
Parameters:
keyword - the keyword to append.
See Also:
PrettyStringBuilder.addKeyword(java.lang.String)

addText

public void addText(String text)
Appends the given text to the pretty string builder. Don't use this method for constants or keywords, but use the PrettyStringBuilder.addConstant(String) and PrettyStringBuilder.addKeyword(String) methods instead.

Specified by:
addText in interface PrettyStringBuilder
Parameters:
text - the text to append.
See Also:
PrettyStringBuilder.addText(java.lang.String)

addType

public void addType(String type)
Appends the given type to the pretty string builder. Types will be highlighted when displayed to the user.

Specified by:
addType in interface PrettyStringBuilder
Parameters:
type - the type to append.
See Also:
PrettyStringBuilder.addType(java.lang.String)

toPrettyString

public PrettyString toPrettyString()
Generates a PrettyString from the current contents of the builder. Note that the returned pretty string is not updated when the contents of the builder change at a later time, but simply represents the current content at the time when this method is called.

Specified by:
toPrettyString in interface PrettyStringBuilder
Returns:
the PrettyString for the current contents of the builder.
See Also:
PrettyStringBuilder.toPrettyString()

determineString

void determineString(StringBuilder buffer,
                     Map<PrettyPrintable,PrettyAnnotation> annotations,
                     PrettyStyle[] styles)
Determines the string representation of this builders contents and adds it to the buffer. The PrettyAnnotations present within this builder will be added to the map of annotations, while the PrettyStyles for the text chunks within this builder will be added to the styles array.

Parameters:
buffer - string buffer to store the characters to.
annotation - map to store the annotations to.
styles - array to store the highlighting styles to (per character).

determineStringLength

int determineStringLength()
Determines the number of characters required to serialize the pretty string builder content to a pretty string.

Returns:
the number of characters in the generated pretty string.
